newsitem.title: USA: Compaq to cut prices on desktops, portables.
newsitem.headline: Compaq to cut prices on desktops, portables.

text.p: Compaq Computer Corp said Monday it will cut U.S. prices on desktops, portables, servers, workstations and networking products in an attempt to increase its market share among business customers.

The company said it will implemnent across-the-board price reductions of up to 17 percent on Compaq Deskpro PCs; price reductions up to 27 percent and promotions on select Compaq Armada 4100 and LTE 5000 notebook PCs; price reductions ranging from four to 20 percent on ProSignia 300 and ProLiant 5000 servers, and free processor and memory promotions on select ProLiant and ProSignia servers; a $400 channel sales promotion and free memory upgrades on select Compaq Professional Workstations; and price reductions of up to 13 percent on select Netelligent network interface controllers.
The company said the reduced prices will be in effect until supplies are out of stock.
